conclusion: Analyze the flow path of the liquid from each inlet through the baffles.
Inlet A is located at the top left corner.
Liquid from inlet A encounters the first baffle (pink) and is directed downward.
Liquid from inlet A hits the second baffle (green) and is directed to the right.
Liquid from inlet A passes through the third baffle (white) and flows into container E.
Inlet B is located at the top center.
Liquid from inlet B encounters the first baffle (pink) and is directed downward.
Liquid from inlet B hits the second baffle (green) and is directed to the right.
Liquid from inlet B passes through the third baffle (white) and flows into container E.
Inlet C is located at the top center-right.
Liquid from inlet C encounters the first baffle (pink) and is directed downward.
Liquid from inlet C hits the second baffle (green) and is directed to the right.
Liquid from inlet C passes through the third baffle (white) and flows into container E.
Inlet D is located at the top right corner.
Liquid from inlet D encounters the first baffle (pink) and is directed downward.
Liquid from inlet D hits the second baffle (green) and is directed to the right.
Liquid from inlet D passes through the third baffle (white) and flows into container E.
All the liquid from inlets A, B, C, and D will flow into container E after passing through the baffles.
